27 Nov 2013

Arduinobot is now Mirobot

The project is still very much alive. After a hiatus of almost two years it's great to be posting something here again.

The first news is that I've changed the name of the project. Arduinobot was a bad name because it piggy-backed on the Arduino brand (which is a bad thing to do) so I've renamed it to Mirobot. There are a few things behind the name but essentially it came from thinking about what an artistic drawing robot might be called. It's named after Joan Mir√≥, the 20th Century Spanish artist.

  • Underpowered steppers - I'm intentionally using smaller steppers to keep the cost down, but powering these from 5V USB means they haven't got much power. I'm going to use a 12V battery pack to get a bit more out of them.
